data.title: Servers need training but love the concept
data.text:
We liked the sushi rolls we had.  Most of the sushi is cooked rolls but they were also fun and tasty. Our server was nice but severely under-trained. The rolls are names of rockers or rock groups for the most part. So when you look at the menu it is quite difficult to find a roll you want to start with. This is where the server should know the rolls well, to help guide you on the first roll and you can read over the menu for your next roll. 

We liked the concept and seems like it could end up being pretty cool. We plan on going back in a couple months to see if the waitstaff has better experience and training by then.

data.title: Fun, delicious take on sushi
data.text:
I visited Rock n Roll Sushi's location at Campus 805 for lunch today. The decor is very Hard Rock Cafe-ish-- lots of framed album art and guitars. When we arrived, the restaurant was nearly full and quite noisy-- there's no acoustic coating or baffling on the metal ceiling or bare concrete floor, so don't expect to have a quiet conversation. The staff quickly seated us and took our drink orders, then brought menus, which are actually made of LPs (remember those?) bound together; I got ZZ Top's "Deguello" and a Joan Jett album. 

The menu features a range of appetizers (which I skipped), conventional sushi, sashimi, and nigiri, and a broad assortment of rock-themed rolls: the Rush roll, the Journey roll, the Ozzy Osbourne, the Elvis, and so on. My date had a Kiss roll (shrimp tempura roll topped with chopped shrimp, scallop, crabmeat, eel sauce, spicy mayo and crunchy flakes), and I had the Ozzy. (tempura shrimp topped with crabmeat and a spicy chili sauce). Both were excellent, as was the side of salmon nigiri I ordered. (Note that the descriptions of rolls in the restaurant's printed menus and the online menus don't match; for example, the online menu has a Titanic roll that the restaurant lacks, and my Ozzy had crabmeat (per the in-house menu) and not tuna as the online menu promises).

Prices are moderate-- figure around $13/roll for the themed items. Service was quick and cheerful. All in all, an enjoyable visit and a fun place for a quick lunch-- we'll be back.

data.title: No wine
data.text: Only wine is Barefoot. Menu looks good, but, if I can't have a decent glass of wine, I'm not interested.…...............

data.title: Good food
data.text: Good food and very nice waitress. they need a drink menu but they said they are working on it.but again good for the price.

data.title: Sushi
data.text: Their food is so good and the people that work there is very nice to the customers I couldn't have picked a better place to get on my vacation.

data.title: New to Campus 805
data.text:
They just opened a few weeks ago at the new Campus 805 which is becoming an excellent venue for food, entertainment and GREAT craft beer.  
I was disappointed in the beer selection here and there service really wasn't that great either.  When we asked for a beer list, I was handed a hand-written list on receipt paper and half of the beers weren't even spelled correctly.  "Line googles" was actually listed but I'm pretty sure they meant Leinenkugel's.  
The sushi menu was pretty creative and there are lots of options to chose from along with some pretty standard options.  
I'm only rating this as average but I do think it has potential.  The server did not know much about the menu items nor the beer and was just "flat."  We also sat there with all of our dirty plates all over the table and he never took any of the empties away. 
 For a "rock and roll" type of place I expected the atmosphere to be a lot more entertaining and fun and the staff to be more engaging and knowledgable about the menu offerings.

data.title: Fresh and Original in Daphne
data.text: This is a new location and a quite new group of Fun Sushi Restaurants.  The dishes are inspired and named after Rock n Roll Bands from the the past era-Elvis to Guns and Roses to Kiss to Cyndi Lauper.....etc.   We tried the Ginger salad, Journey Roll and the Tuna Twister.  It was all fresh and the sauces were well done......slightly sweet but not overdone.  The theme is Rock n Roll with many classics playing as we ate lunch.  This place has a really fresh take and could be a great hit if it is well run.  it was very clean and the service was good.

data.title: Grand Opening
data.text: Brand new place, very modern, delicious. We went for lunch. They were completely out of our original order (Spider Roll), but we built our own roll and it was exceptional.
